prompt: <description>Part 1 Instructions Creating the Coordinate System Begin by creating a new coordinate system for the first part. Set the Euler angles to 0 degrees for all axes and the translation vector to 0,0,0. This will establish the base position and orientation for the part. Creating the Sketch For this part, create a sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. The sketch consists of two loops, each formed by four lines. 1. Loop 1: - Line 1: Start Point at 0,0; End Point at 0.75,0. - Line 2: Start Point at 0.75,0; End Point at 0.75,0.2924. - Line 3: Start Point at 0.75,0.2924; End Point at 0,0.2924. - Line 4: Start Point at 0,0.2924; End Point at 0,0. 2. Loop 2: - Line 1: Start Point at 0.0305,0.0295; End Point at 0.7195,0.0295. - Line 2: Start Point at 0.7195,0.0295; End Point at 0.7195,0.2629. - Line 3: Start Point at 0.7195,0.2629; End Point at 0.0305,0.2629. - Line 4: Start Point at 0.0305,0.2629; End Point at 0.0305,0.0295. Both loops form a closed shape with no arcs or circles. Scaling the Sketch Apply a scaling factor of 0.75 to the entire sketch. Extruding the Sketch Extrude the sketch by 0.1229 units in the positive Z direction, creating a 3D solid from the 2D sketch. This completes the first part of the CAD assembly. Part Dimensions The length and width of this part are both 0.75 units, and the height is 0.1229 units. This part is the base for the assembly and will be used to construct subsequent parts using the specified boolean operation.</description>
